intro: Eriogonum brevicaule subsp. canum, commonly known as the shortstem flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its flowers are usually pink to purple and bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is adapted to arid conditions and has a deep root system to access water.
